{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of fever and chills occurring two hours after surgery are suggestive of an acute transfusion reaction. Adverse effects of medication would likely present with additional symptoms such as rash, gastrointestinal upset, or changes in mental status. Malignant hyperthermia typically presents with hyperthermia and muscle rigidity, which are not present in this case. A urinary tract infection would not present so acutely after catheter placement and would likely have additional symptoms such as dysuria or urinary frequency.", "answer_choice": "D. Transfusion reaction"}
